{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3170142,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T12:18:57.047Z","cooked":"

As implied , can somebody help me understand the difference between extending PIDSubsystem vs ProfiledPIDSubsystem and how to know which one we really want to use. Until recently, we had just assumed ProfiledPIDSubsytem was a subtype of PIDSubsystem but it turns out they live on their own branches of the family tree.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-22T12:18:57.047Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":241.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":431259,"topic_slug":"pidsubsystem-vs-profiledpidsubsystem","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/pidsubsystem-vs-profiledpidsubsystem/431259/1","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3170144,"name":"Josh Weeks","username":"MojoFilter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mojofilter/{size}/182835_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T12:29:20.715Z","cooked":"

Ok, so I just realized that you can’t assign a motion profile to a standard PID controller, so that makes this question kinda dumb, but I’ll leave it here for prosperity. You never know who it might help.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-03-22T12:29:38.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":431259,"topic_slug":"pidsubsystem-vs-profiledpidsubsystem","display_username":"Josh Weeks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56675,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Destroyer of Worlds"},"post_url":"/t/pidsubsystem-vs-profiledpidsubsystem/431259/2","custom_user_title":"Destroyer of Worlds","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3170145,"name":"Dylan Powers","username":"Dylan1259","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dylan1259/{size}/161876_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T12:31:06.168Z","cooked":"

The WPILib docs would help answer this question. I recommend checking them out for a full answer.

Thr short answer is that a ProfiledPID follows a trapezoidal velocity curve. It does this using the maxVelocity and maxAcceleration that you give it. This allows for the most efficient and smoothest motion. The Subsystem will increase its velocity at its given max acceleration until it reaches max velocity where it will stay until it needs to decelerate at its max acceleration to reach the setpoint.

Again doing some research in the docs and in google will give aome more info.

Hey, thanks. I appreciate the help, but the big source of confusion came from when we did google it and found that the types were very similar but did not share any inheritance. If we hadn’t looked it up in the first place, then we would never have had a question. I appreciate the suggestion, though. If we forget to look up information on our problem next time, we’ll be sure to come straight to you, Dylan.

MojoFilter:

their own branches of the family tree

Yes, they are different beasts but they intimately co-habitat. From the Rev Smart Motion “Trapezoidal Motion Profiling” example:

  • Since REV Smart Motion uses the velocity to track a profile, there are only two steps required to configure this mode:
    1. Tune a velocity PID loop for the mechanism
    2. Configure the smart motion parameters

First get the Kp, Ki, Kd then lay on your desired max velocity and max acceleration to define the trapezoid for the PID controller to follow.
